content.prompt: Peter runs a small business mowing lawns and cleaning pools. The production possibilities curve provided shows the combinations of lawns mowed and/or pools cleaned that Peter can complete in a day. Which of the following is true concerning Peter’s production possibilities curve?

choices.label: Peter can mow more than 6 lawns if he doesn’t clean any pools that day.
Peter’s opportunity cost of mowing 1 lawn is 12 of a pool cleaned.
Peter’s opportunity cost of cleaning 1 pool is 12 of a lawn mowed.
Peter experiences increasing opportunity costs in cleaning pools.
Peter experiences increasing opportunity costs in mowing lawns.

topic.text: 1.2: Opportunity Cost and the Production Possibilities Curve (PPC)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
